page.title: 18RECREATION IN LEADENHAM
page.content: Although Leadenham is only a small village,there is a well maintained playing field where a number of sports are played.There are at present about twenty members of the cricket club who practise regularly and play an average of once a week. They play in the Lincoln & District League.The Club was formed about twelve years ago.The Bowls Club has eighteen to twenty members and also has a green at the playing fields.The members play in the Cliff League against neighbouring villages.The Tennis Club is run on a voluntary basis. The 40 members and the local school each have a key. They let themselves in to the court and lock up afterwards.This is purely a village club,though members from nearby villages use the court.Summer visitors pay by the hour.
